hobby.message: You flying analog or digital FPV drones these days?
Urban exploration still your kind of therapy?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah. Still dry. Waited out a patrol earlier.
Supposed to rain, but no sign yet.
Not much to do outside these days.
Hard to even fly my drones lately.
Dry enough. Wind picked up on the river, though.
Haven't seen many people on the old docks.
Tried flying one of my FPV drones. Didn't last long.
Signal interference everywhere since the Tribunal blackout.
Feels like someone's always watching now.
Pretty dry out there. Good for drone flights if you pick the right spot.
I fly FPV drones—freestyle, not racing. Peaceful when it works.
Whole city's been on edge since the media blackout.
Lost signal twice near the freight yard. Jammers must be testing their limits.
Used to see a few flyers out. Not anymore.
Had to pack up after spotlights came on.
Dry, but the city feels different. Empty. Nervous, maybe.
I always fly my FPV drone near the industrial zone—helps me clear my head.
Last weekend, analog interference ruined three flights. Never used to happen.
I miss those old rooftop meets with other flyers.
Spotlights triggered when I got too high. No warning, just... light.
I’m more careful these days—can’t afford another BCI penalty.
Feels like even our hobbies are getting flagged, you know?
Dry, yeah. But honestly, it feels like Stenograd's drying up in other ways.
Flying FPV drones used to be my escape. I built my first one from salvage when I was sixteen.
Since Halden died, the city’s gotten paranoid—more jammers, fewer safe spots to fly.
During the blackout, patrols chased off three regulars from the yard. One just disappeared.
Last Sunday, spotlights found me mid-flight. No sirens, but I packed up fast.
Feels risky just being out there now. Even analog isn’t safe.
I tweak the firmware to keep my drone signals hidden. I won't let the BCI track me.
Funny—these days I trust drones more than people. At least they don’t report you.
hobby_answer: Analog only. Digital gets flagged too fast now.
Flew last weekend, signal was weird. Had to leave early.
Spotlights came on, no warnings. Never saw that before.
Not many out flying these days.
Not worth the risk right now.
Mostly analog lately. Less traceable, but the jammers are getting smarter.
Flew after the Tribunal blackout. Place was deserted.
Lost video more than once—too much interference.
City’s too quiet. People are laying low.
Saw patrols by the yard, packed up fast.
Not a good time to fly alone.
Analog’s my go-to now. Digital’s almost useless with all the lockdowns.
Hit the East Terminal after the Tribunal blackout.
No other flyers around—used to be busy there.
Kept losing signal, interference everywhere.
Spotlights tracked my drone, but no alarms or warnings.
City feels off, even out by the dead zones.
I just fly quick and get home these days.
Always analog now. Digital feeds drop dead, especially near the industrial zones.
Flew right after the blackout—place was empty and silent.
Used to meet other flyers out by the yard. Not lately.
Interference has gotten worse—can’t risk long flights.
Spotted automated spotlights pinging my drone, zero human response.
Wasn’t sure if it was a warning or a test.
Had to take my drone apart just to get home safe.
Feels like even a harmless flight could get me flagged now.
Analog is the only way now. Digital’s like flying with a target on your back.
I hit the East Terminal right after Directorate locked things down.
No more meeting friends there—everyone’s afraid after the Tribunal mess.
Used to test new mods out there, but I just grab short flights now.
Lost signal three times. Jammers are everywhere, even in the supposed safe spots.
Spotlights tagged my drone—quiet but pointed. That’s new.
Packed up in two minutes flat. Didn’t see another flyer all night.
Strange, all the old crew have gone silent. Feels risky even mentioning their names.
Makes you wonder how many hobbies we’ll lose before people really push back.
